flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: Let's make a super cool star! Flip it over and WOW - it's another design.
lines.text_raw: Let's make a super cool star! Flip it over and WOW - it's another design.

lines.text: You need 12 Pieces of 3x3 origami paper.
lines.text_raw: You need 12 Pieces of 3x3 origami paper.

lines.text: If you want to have cool pattern designs on each side, you need to make sure your paper's pattern is always going the correct direction.
lines.text_raw: If you want to have cool pattern designs on each side, you need to make sure your paper's pattern is always going the correct direction.

lines.text: Pick a side, then make a small crease by folding it in half. Crease only the top section.
lines.text_raw: Pick a side, then make a small crease by folding it in half. Crease only the top section.

lines.text: This will be your guide in the first step, but folding all of them now will help keep the pattern correct.
lines.text_raw: This will be your guide in the first step, but folding all of them now will help keep the pattern correct.

lines.text: First piece - color side up, with the small crease you made in the last step on the left.
lines.text_raw: First piece - color side up, with the small crease you made in the last step on the left.

lines.text: Fold the bottom-right point up to the crease while making sure it makes a super point in the top right. You may have to fidget with it a bit.
lines.text_raw: Fold the bottom-right point up to the crease while making sure it makes a super point in the top right. You may have to fidget with it a bit.

lines.text: Fold back, with the edge along the crease you just made.
lines.text_raw: Fold back, with the edge along the crease you just made.

lines.text: Fold the other side over to meet the right side, again making sure that you have a nice point at the top.
lines.text_raw: Fold the other side over to meet the right side, again making sure that you have a nice point at the top.

lines.text: Again, fold paper back. Both sides should look the same.
lines.text_raw: Again, fold paper back. Both sides should look the same.

lines.text: Fold in half, making sure the "wings" are on the outside.
lines.text_raw: Fold in half, making sure the "wings" are on the outside.

lines.text: Fold the top down along the straight "wing."
lines.text_raw: Fold the top down along the straight "wing."

lines.text: Another view.
lines.text_raw: Another view.

lines.text: Open up the whole unit with color side down.
lines.text_raw: Open up the whole unit with color side down.

lines.text: Fold in each side "wing." You will not be making a new crease; you should be using an existing crease.
lines.text_raw: Fold in each side "wing." You will not be making a new crease; you should be using an existing crease.

lines.text: Turn over - color side up.
lines.text_raw: Turn over - color side up.

lines.text: Fold the bottom point up. You should fold it up to where the 2 side creases meet.
lines.text_raw: Fold the bottom point up. You should fold it up to where the 2 side creases meet.

lines.text: Let the model collapse. Folding the unit in half will make the "shovel" fold outward.
lines.text_raw: Let the model collapse. Folding the unit in half will make the "shovel" fold outward.

lines.text: This is the finished unit.
lines.text_raw: This is the finished unit.

lines.text: Make all 12. Lay 2 out as shown. I like to call the piece of the unit that sticks out the "shovel."
lines.text_raw: Make all 12. Lay 2 out as shown. I like to call the piece of the unit that sticks out the "shovel."

lines.text: Take 2 pieces and place the "shovel" under the inside point of the other piece.
lines.text_raw: Take 2 pieces and place the "shovel" under the inside point of the other piece.

lines.text: Slide the "shovel" up to the top. Fold.
lines.text_raw: Slide the "shovel" up to the top. Fold.

lines.text: Take the little flap and tuck it into the other piece. This will lock the two together.
lines.text_raw: Take the little flap and tuck it into the other piece. This will lock the two together.

lines.text: Continue with the rest of the pieces.
lines.text_raw: Continue with the rest of the pieces.

lines.text: Locking the last piece can be tricky. Just take your time.
lines.text_raw: Locking the last piece can be tricky. Just take your time.

lines.text: Voilà! Each side of your star is different!!
lines.text_raw: Voilà! Each side of your star is different!!

guide.summary: Make the origami Eiffel Star designed by Hans-Werner Guth.
guide.title: Origami Eifel Star
